author: Baha'u'llah
source_text: أَسْئَلُكَ يا مَنْ لا تُعْرَفُ بِغَيْرِكَ وَلا تُدْرَكَ بِسِواكَ بِمَظْلُومِيَّةِ مَطْلَعِ أَمْرِكَ بَيْنَ أَراذِلِ خَلْقِكَ وَبِما وَرَدَ عَلَيهِ فِي سَبِيْلِكَ بِأَنْ تَجْعَلَنِيْ فِي كُلِّ الأَحْوالِ راضِيًا بِرِضائِكَ وَناظِرًا إِلى أُفُقِ مَشِيَّتِكَ وَمُسْتَقِيمًا عَلَى مَحَبَّتِكَ،
translation: I implore Thee, O Thou Who art inscrutable to all except Thee, and can be comprehended through naught else save Thyself, by the wrongs which He Who is the Dayspring of Thy Cause hath suffered at the hands of the ignoble among Thy creatures, and by what hath befallen Him in Thy path, to grant that I may, at all times, be wholly dissolved in Thee, and fix my gaze upon the horizon of Thy will and be steadfast in Thy love.
